intro: Hymenocallis multiflora, commonly known as the clustered hurricane lily, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, funnel-shaped white flowers with a yellow throat. The plant produces multiple flower clusters along its stem, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. It has strap-like, evergreen leaves that remain throughout the year, and it thrives in well-drained soil in full sun. Hymenocallis multiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in warm climates.
